newsitem.title: FRANCE: Promodes jumps on German sale talk.
newsitem.headline: Promodes jumps on German sale talk.

text.p: Shares in retailer Promodes jumped by more than three percent on a newspaper report it was close to sell its German stores to Spar AG.
But the share lost some of its advance after a company spokesman said that the future of the German unit would be decided on in September of early October.
At 0853, Promodes was up 32 francs, or 2.58 percent, at 1,270 francs. It had hot a high of 1,295 francs.
"The finalisation of the German dossier is close. It will be settled in September or early October," a spokesman for the company said.
The Les Echos newspaper had said this morning that a deal might be decided on this Tuesday during a board meeting and added the likely buyer of the 36 stores was Spar AG.
"We know Spar well, because we sold them four stores last year. But we have worked with other groups, Spar is among others," the spokesman said.
